descriptions: No attempt or completely incorrect application of derivative formulas.
Demonstrates minimal understanding; frequent errors in applying derivative formulas. Struggles to differentiate basic functions.
Shows some understanding but makes several errors in calculating derivatives of algebraic and trigonometric functions. Difficulty with inverse trigonometric, exponential, or logarithmic functions.

Calculates derivatives of algebraic and trigonometric functions with reasonable accuracy. Minor errors may be present. Begins to apply derivative formulas to inverse trigonometric, exponential, and logarithmic functions with some errors.
Accurately calculates derivatives of algebraic, trigonometric, and exponential functions. Demonstrates a good understanding of the derivative formulas for these functions with only minor errors.

Calculates derivatives of algebraic, trigonometric, inverse trigonometric, exponential, and logarithmic functions with high accuracy. Demonstrates a complete and thorough understanding of all derivative formulas and their application.
Unable to identify or apply appropriate derivative formulas.
Struggles to select the correct derivative formula; application is often incorrect or inappropriate.
Can sometimes identify the correct derivative formula but struggles with its application in various contexts.
Usually selects the correct derivative formula and applies it with some accuracy, but may struggle with complex problems.
Consistently selects and applies the correct derivative formulas in a variety of problems. Demonstrates a strong ability to differentiate most functions effectively.

Masterfully selects and applies the correct derivative formulas with precision and efficiency, even in highly complex and novel problems. Demonstrates an exceptional ability to differentiate any function.
Demonstrates no understanding of derivative concepts.
Displays minimal understanding of what a derivative represents. Unable to explain the basic concepts.
Shows some basic understanding but struggles to explain the meaning or significance of derivatives.
Understands the basic concepts of derivatives and can explain them in simple terms, but struggles with deeper implications.
Demonstrates a solid understanding of derivative concepts and can explain their significance in mathematical contexts.
Demonstrates a deep and nuanced understanding of derivative concepts, including their geometric and physical interpretations. Can articulate these concepts clearly and insightfully.
